Pistachio Dacquoise with chocolate chili mousse, salted caramel and cocoa cookie. If that sounds good on paper, it was even better on the tongue.   Overall, this was a delightful beginning to our trip. There's nothing like a complete lack of expectation to allow for immense pleasure, and since we knew nothing beforehand, every great moment was enhanced. Had it not been for the two missteps, this would have been an easy five star night for us. In fact, even with them it really still was for me.   Best Plates: Day Boat Scallops, Rasam Fire Broth, Samosas, prawn Masala, Duck Vindaloo, Bhatura, Dosa, Pistachio Dacquoise with Chocolate Chili Mousse  Palate: moderately exotic  Food - A- Ambience - A+ Service - A- Value - A-

xZd2NXtpjWmWGdZDWRpPQA.review_text: Best Indian food so far! This place never disappoints me. Love the food, service and ambiance. Specially love their Sambhar

ootiFwOHNxWxUX1kadu15g.review_text: I love the overall decor and ambiance of this place! You definitely feel like your walking into a high class restaurant. I ordered the green mango and paneer dosa and it was pretty delicious! The overall dosa has a nice crisp texture and the filling is flavorful. You get the dosa with 2 types of different chutney's and sambar! I like their spicy chutney and it paired really well with my dosa. The sambar was pleasing to the taste buds as well.  For all those people who don't take dosa on the regular- dip the dosa in the sambar and then take it with the chutney!  Only thing is it is pricy! Service  was good and this spot is definitely perfect to take that special someone on a special occasion i.e Valentines day!! The dim lighting gives an romantic flare and I wish that I had come on a date here rather than with my friends JK...next time!

45PdJ5LYQIL8_qf4UdbpPw.review_text: Ok, the most authentic Indian dosa that I have ever had in the States, is here. I had the Lamb Keema dosa, with some extra Parathas. Friends had Masala dosa and chilli garlic dosa, we did order a plate of bhel puri, pani puri and Kale pakoras. The best appetizer in a really really long time is Kale Pakoras - light crunchy and fresh - A MUST TRY here. It was a little expensive overall, but I guess you can't help that in a city. We spent almost $30 a head. But, worth it in my opinion.   Tip: Make sure you make a reservation if you need a table of 5 or more.

dIIKEfOgo0KqUfGQvGikPg.review_text: Dosa On Fillmore is definitely not your typical Indian restaurant!  It's classy and modern with a friendly staff and excellent unique food.  My first visit was with a large group, so we ordered family style and shared half of the menu items, so I definitely got a great taste of what they have to offer.  I didn't taste anything I didn't like by the way!  During my most recent visit, there were just two of us and we sat at the bar. While they offer some awesome looking cocktails and the bartenders are super fun to watch as they prepare them, Tiffany and I opted for champagne and wine respectively.  We also shared two appetizers: Grilled Calamari and the North and South Samosas.  Tiffany went with a signature dosa for her main course and I ate every last drop of the Vegetable Curry with coconut rice.  I left crazy full; it was flavorful and filling!  If you like Indian cuisine but are looking for a more upscale ambiance and diverse drink menu to go along with it, Dosa is for you.  Just make sure you make a reservation ahead of time if you have a large group.  And if it's just one or two of you, the bar or community table are awesome... maybe you'll meet a new friend while you are there?!

YeEUeu7W3TM9PjBsGlyktg.review_text: Dosa Dosa Dosa  The restaurant is beautiful! So elegant with warm lights and inviting colors. You don't get bored looking around. Made a reservation about 40 minutes prior to getting there and was seated pretty quickly upon arrival.  Started with the idli sambar small plates. The delicious bowl of sambar is super flavorful and the two idli's peek out at you, ready to be devoured. Warms you up and excites you for more food. I loved the "thuriya" green beans in there that pop into four you eat the insides of. Reminded me of the noms my mom used to make.  I decided (after much contemplation) on the roasted chile and garlic masala dosa and boy was that a great choice. I love garlic, I love heat, and I love complex flavor. This dish had all of that. I nominate this star of the show.  Other honorable mentions:  Quinoa "thinnai" uttapam Raita (double- you will eat all of it) chutneys Masala dosa  The potatoes and cashews were on point, authentic, SPICY, and delicious.   Towards the end of our meal, the guy taking our plates spilled chutney all overrrr one of the jackets on the chair. Manager was super nice and comped a dessert and promised to cover dry cleaning. Totally appreciated that.  So awesome they have a menu that provides alternatives for dietary restrictions.  It's not cheap, but it's worth it when you want a filling, quality meal you will be reminiscing about for hours.

Sp-S4y8rx1xIX3d5VOK0bQ.review_text: You would be hard-pressed to find something amiss at Dosa (well, I'm sure there are those out there who could find it...but then, they're just cranky!).  This restaurant has something for everyone! Sexy date-night spot? Check! Fun space for groups? Check! Happy hour with friends? Check! A place to impress out-of-towners? Check!  The food is wonderful...not your traditional Indian fare...but oh-so delicious and a perfect way to comfortably ease your non-adventurous food friends into trying something besides meat and potatoes!  Everything on the menu is wonderful...a must have is the paper masala dosa. They have the most wonderful, flavorful and rich curries and sauces. They even have some tasty items for the no-meaties in your life.  The drinks are wonderful!   Yeah, I'm a total fan =)

zL5xO3tqNnWFPzPK_EaFQg.review_text: I really enjoyed my meal but everyone else I went with thought it was just OK.   paneer masala with coocnut rice was DELICIOUS!! I would definitely recommend it!  the coconut cake is also delicious if you're looking for a dessert. lots of levels and textures of coconut. the syrup was a little on the sweet side but very enjoyable!

O9CT4KJMPJ-mN3Yphd1FNA.review_text: You will enjoy food in an elegant and fun atmosphere like club. Good for date/friends gathering.   My first experiment with dosa didn't work well. My yam dosa is too sweet for me as a dish, but other people enjoyed their non sweet / meat dosa.  I enjoyed their mango lasse: much thicker and much more creamy than other places I have been.  Polite and attentive server.

ecm8k--h0S5E5lt99bASlQ.user_location: Lower Pacific Heights, San Francisco, CA
ecm8k--h0S5E5lt99bASlQ.review_text: Good service, full bar, good location, but I ordered Masala Dosa.. It tastes just below average.. It was just cold dosa..I don't know about other dishes.

kUXd6OQmKUJ1brrkZbj7WA.review_text: Never walk in, always make a reservation. You might have to wait otherwise. I ordered a onion chilli uttappam and cried while eating. The uttappam was super spicy, just the way i like it. I could not stop at one! :D  Mysore masala dosa and onion rava dosa are also my favorites!! It might be a little pricey but its definitely worth it.

vLwcdPle32X7GgT06BQVRA.review_text: Indian restaurant for white people. Food was plain. Service was plain. You can get the same stuff or better at a Mom and Pops place for half the price. Prices are ridiculous. If you're into the free-range pretentious yuppie over-priced Whole-Foods experience, this is your place. There was absolutely no charm, ambience, nothing. Never again. And geez, at the very least, teach the waiters how to pronounce the damn names of the food!

4lVT1jQmCrQWeLbG-gtSUg.review_text: This place is legit. Great atmosphere. Restaurant week menu offered good variety. Favorite dish was the truffle dosa and green chili dosa. Great Indian food, wine, and drink menu.

c2vxfYMtcSNrq3iZqaN4Nw.review_text: You cannot go wrong with the atmosphere here, it's really beautiful. It's a nice place to stop by for a drink after work or with some friends before dinner.  Both the service and food are average and the location is heavily over priced. We went later in the evening and most of the lamb and chicken items on the menu were sold out. I don't think that is the right, if it's on the menu, it should be available or the customer should be told upfront that certain items aren't available.   What we did order was alright. Nothing special or memorable. I may try it out again earlier in the day/evening to experience the variety offered.

1iMtOlXd7BRaCDejF1wZIA.review_text: This is Indian Food for Americans at its best/worst. Absolutely NOT authentic which I guess is ok because I think they are going for a gourmet feel. The atmosphere is so nice - elegant and chic at the same time.   But the food was disappointing. Their dosa isn't crispy! Lacking in flavor, which is sad for South Indian food. Would only go there for the atmosphere if the people I'm with dont care about good food.

cdp0w-U06hY6RvRUx81tpQ.review_text: This is the perfect spot for a hot Saturday night date.  Make a reservation (it gets super busy) and be prepared to get a bit overloaded by the very large drink, appetizer, and dinner menu.  Once you maneuver your way through the beast of options, it is smooth sailing.  Ambiance is great, food delicious, and overall a nice intro to Indian cuisine.  Highly recommend making your way over to Sundance Kabuki theater for a late-night movie post date.  #soliddatenight

LA3el9uHyCjn_yj-A1sUcg.review_text: Incredible. I know next to nothing (okay, just nothing...) about Indian food, so I can't speak to the authenticity of the flavors, preparations, etc. What I do know is that every dish I had here was delicious!   We arrived 45 minutes late for our reservation on a Friday night due to some ridiculous traffic downtown. Thankfully, we called ahead and the hostess was gracious enough to seat us anyway. We started with a round of Peonys - gin, hibiscus masala nectar (!!), coconut cream, chile, and lime. It was a little bit too sweet for me, but that coconut cream was divine.   Between the four of us, we split the spicy basil dosa, chef's selection of 5 uttapam, chicken korma curry, spicy basil prawns, a side of coconut rice, and bhatura. I loved the different chutneys and sambhar that arrived with the dosa and uttapam. The combination of spicy, smokey, cool / refreshing was perfect! There were so many flavors all at once. The curries were very good as well. The chicken was super tender and the prawns had this unique smooth and smokey taste to them. My favorites were the bhatura and the prawns.   Even though we were stuffed, we still split 3 desserts between the four of us. I loved the fresh coconut cream custard. It was a tad too sweet because it was sitting in a light syrup but the coconut textures and flavors were so good that it didn't even matter. We also enjoyed the apricot chiboust, which was apricot tapioca with coconut cream on top. Our least favorite was the raspberry mascarpone tart. The only part I liked about the tart was the chantilly cream it came with :/.   Dosa is a great spot for a date night or for catching up with friends. I will definitely be back!

Kr2Of3kgiUyNz74OyXnWnw.review_text: I don't come here that often, but it's always a delicious treat when I do. The ambiance and decor are great, the food has never disappointed! So much flavor. I have gotten several dosas here, and the mixed uttapam dish. One time I had the tasting menu, which ended up being way too much food for me. I ended up taking a whole course home without eating it, but that's ok! Tasty leftovers!  Friendly service as well.

rhROLqZmn8HiSJGUn8cB-A.review_text: Disappointed. Here for Diwali dinner, music is so loud that if almost feels like a club. Requested to turn down the volume but was refused. Only offer by the manager was to move to a corner table.

L6fhF9h-JWRq02b7D5geQA.review_text: amazing atmosphere and really great dosas! we shared a lot of the items and it was an enjoyable experience. the green mango dosa was my favorite!

l-dsn44jql6ujOUrE91adw.review_text: Altho the staff was nice the place was dark & difficult to even see my food! And what's with the techno music??!!! It was hard to carry on a conversation with my fellow diners!  The food we ordered was done well & flavors were good but I'm giving it a one star because of the atmosphere!

hCyGy0XVGF--OsoTP522ZQ.review_text: I've never had a bad meal at DOSA. I've never had bad service at DOSA. I love that they change up their menus at times, yet also keep my favorites. Mumsy and I came here for our post-massage, birthday treat.   Mumsy is a bit hard of hearing (when she wants to be!) so we opted for the mezzanine - the high vaulted ceilings (I'm told it was formerly a bank) is not conducive to intimate convos, but upstairs the acoustics are better.  Our waiter was very helpful and all the staff will help you with any food decisions. We went all vegetarian with the Seasonal Squash Pakora (I think I inhaled the first three), the Dahi Vada (which was beautiful and delicious - I wish I'd taken a photo!), and the Paper Masala (two small plates and one dosa). It didn't seem like a lot but it was so filling and so delicious that I continued to eat after I was full.   Also, I left a paper bag with some odds and ends at my table and the waiter ran after us chased me across the street in the rain to return it to me - so sweet!

3PThFhwBwI8xnGCrFQ467g.review_text: I don't know where to begin to rave about this place. One of the finest places to go to dig into some exotic South Indian cuisine..this place has a. different vibe and the decor and food is to die for . A little pricey and extremely busy over the weekend but worth every penny for this high end indian fusion food :)

UaFrZ5obw9q1XAFF6_QsBA.review_text: I LOVE the food. Amazing food. Some authentic, some nouveau. Intriguing cocktails, great space.  But generally mediocre service. Otherwise, would have been a 5.

oPLC3BhtjaSyoP0XlGFOwA.review_text: The quality of food here has gone down from a year or two ago. I went here thrice over the last few months and have always felt really queasy after the meal. Something is fishy with the oil they use. Looking at all the recent great reviews, I may have just been unlucky. Well, its three strikes for me and I'm not going back.

OST3W4R3Oac-YTGkgc5YiQ.review_text: Made a reservation for a Friday night, sadly Dosa refused to honor it.  Half an hour after the reservation they "kindly" offered to seat us in the communal area, but weren't interested in giving us menus or a waiter.  The loud, throbbing music was a plus while waiting.  Excellent food.  Not!

JGdKYphlPcJTBhHBjCfdig.review_text: Grilled Calamari (Seasoned with cilatro, cumin, chiles, onions, & lime) $10: Calamari was on the rubbery side, but the sauce had a hidden kick to it. Note: add the lime juice on top, it completes the dish. s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com… Samosas 'North & South' (Savory pastries filled with caramelized onions & vegetables (South) and spiced potatos (North) $9: I liked the North Samosa better than the South. The North was more flavorful. I didn't bother using the two sauces they provided with the samosas; however, the South Samosa was a bit bland and needed the extra sauces. s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com… Hyderabadi Chicken Briyani (Bone-in, natural, basmati rice with an aromatic spiced sauce, caramelized onions, cashews, peas) $20: Hrm... not worth $20 bucks, but it was the spiciest briyani I have had so far ( I say that in a good way). There is something in the dish that they forgot to remove because it made the first couple of bites unbearable. After the weird taste went away, the rest of the briyani I had was good. s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com… Duck Vindaloo (Spicy, goan curry, red chiles, malt vinegar, ginger, cumin, mini potatoes, curry leaves) $19: mMmmm duck! we got two drum sticks and a couple of mini pieces of meat scattered around. The meat was very tender and the sauce was ok, but as an entree dish the portion was small.  s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com… Mango Prawns (Reductions of coconut milk, red chiles, ginger, red onions & spices) $17: This was by far my favorite dish of the night. My favorite dish of the night. The shrimp was cooked to perfection with the addition of fresh mango cubes and sweet sauce... it was the bomb. s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com… Coconut rice ($3): You can definitely smell the coconut, but you can't really taste it. I do recommend ordering this if you are getting a curry entree. Roasted Chile & Garlic Masala Dosa (Masala dosa layered with spread of spicy chutney) $11.50: This dish was very interesting, Dosa is the thin crepe like layer over mashed potatoes. The dosa itself was very spicy and when dipped in the sauces provided, it was pretty tasty! I didn't taste the garlic, but over all, it was really spicy and interesting to eat. I would recommend trying this dish if you ever come here. s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com… Service was disappointing, I think I waited 20 mins before the waitress came to explain what dosa was and other unique dishes they had. Then another 10 mins passed before she came back to take our order. Between meals, it took over 20 mins to get our main dishes. Even trying to waive someone down to pack our left overs and requesting for our check was difficult.

tLrOa9G85Ct993dE7fo9NA.review_text: My brother has been raving about this place for ages and so last week we were lucky enough to get a last minute reservation for prime time seating. Decor is fancy but not stuffy. It was crowded and therefore a little loud, but it would be a very nice place for a date. We were a little early so we decided to sit at the bar and sip on cocktails until our table was ready. We had the Peony and the Gin & Tonic (with cardamom, yum!). Both were great.   Shortly after getting the drinks, we were told our table was ready (a bit ahead of our 7:30pm reservation time). The hostess transferred the tab seamlessly.  The tasting menu looked amazing but we opted for appetizers & dosas. Here's what we ate:  Appetizers: Lamb Kofta Samosas 'North & South'  Dosas: Lamb 'Keema'  Spicy Mung Masala  Everything was brought out hot & fresh - the lamb kofta was particularly tasty and I ended up sopping up the remaining sauce with my pappadum (they had to bring us 2 baskets, we gobbled them up so quickly). The samosas were also very good, not oily and easily shared.   I like my food to have a bit of a kick, so I opted for the spicy mung masala - which was great and perfectly spicy. When my brother was distracted and looking away, I nibbled on his lamb keema and *almost* wished I'd ordered that instead, until I took another bite off my own plate and my taste buds did another jig for joy. We really should have split each dosa in half and shared. Next time.   Eat the dosas with your hands for maximum enjoyment. This is probably one of the best South Indian restaurants I've eaten at (it's even better than some of the food that we had in India...shhh!)

WNsAImC1ioixNP_2lOAZ4Q.review_text: DOSA has a great atmosphere and everyone there is extremely friendly.  First off, MAKE RESERVATIONS.  party of 4 was seated. We saw groups that were standing at the bar when we got there and were there when we left!  Their drinks are little unique, I had the Whiskey drink which was good (but you can only have one or two). The first dish we got was the dipping sauce sampler. That was great, my favorite was the Kale dip (good for snacking).   I also had the spicy Roasted Chili & Garlic Masala and my girlfriend had Mysore Masala. They both were moderately spicy (not as spicy as it sounds on the menu).   It was a tad pricy, about $77 for the couple (not including drinks) but we were stuffed after that! It is a great place for a date (or double date as we did). I had a great time and encourage anyone to give it a try.

4-bzS1q7EPkSb4bLwMOnQQ.review_text: I have to clarify that up until this update, I've only dined during lunch service and happy hours (at the bar).  Bf and I love their bengali gimlets and chennai chicken.  We decided to try their dinner service and made a reservation for 9PM on Christmas eve (off to carol service afterwards).  When we both left, we concluded that we will stick to our happy hour dining here instead.  Maybe they've had a busy evening and the waiter was tired but it felt like he wanted us out of there because he was on his last string.  The food came out VERY fast (before our gimlets), we certainly felt very rushed.  We were basically given our check 50 minutes after we sat down and we had appetizers and a main along with cocktails.  Plus the techno music was WAY loud to the point of annoying. So, a very disappointing dinner experience in the dining room and we will be sure to keep our 5:30PM happy hour at the bar with nibbles and drinks there going forward.    I swear, if Christmas eve was my first time at Dosa, I would have written a one star and vow never to return.

TmhFYYTHodJnrubq9IeFNA.review_text: Went here for lunch on a Saturday and really enjoyed our time compared to dinner. For one thing, everything is cheaper! I don't like to pay a lot for Indian food LOL. You can get the best for cheap. Also for weekends they have the South Indian Thali, which is a combination of 10-12 curries, chutneys, etc small dishes. LOVE it!! And great deal for $17 (with lamb, $15 for vegetarian). It reminded me of dim sum.. so kinda like Indian dim sum! So yeah we'll be back for weekend lunch!

p08A1KxUMeC0Jar_su7I-Q.review_text: Went here for a dinner date after recommendations from friends. Definitely a nice environment with dim lighting and a great date night atmosphere. The wine list was good-- though quite pricey. My boyfriend thought it would be a great place to take me because I LOVE Indian food, but the menu is very small and didn't have any of my favorite Indian choices. The server told us that if we had never had a Dosa before, we had to try one. Since we had not, we ordered the traditional Masala Dosa. When it came out it looked like an over sized pancake with a big scoop of mashed potatoes in the center. We opened it up and had to spread the filling over the whole "pancake". It tasted how it looked and the dipping sauces did not add much flavor.  My trip to Dosa was highly anticipated after hearing many great reviews, but my experience was not good. Friends say that next time we go we should order one of the entrees and not the Dosa, but I am not sure we will be going back.

qEdxnnadZ2tcU9JOXjnGdw.review_text: #198. Came here for a friend's birthday.  Probably the classiest Indian restaurant I've been to.  If you come here without trying the dosas, you're doing it wrong.  This was my first dosa experience, and I'm not gonna lie, the dosa was much bigger and longer than I had thought.  My order came with some lamb and ended up having enough for a second meal.  Mmm.  If you're in the mood for Indian food, give this place a try!  There is also another location in the Mission, but that place is much, much smaller.  Come here instead for a shorter wait.  __________ My 2¢: - First timers: I don't think I really need to say this.  Get a dosa.

wpazdZ37epyyUslec-ujcg.review_text: Such pretty restaurant filled with so many flavors and spices! Everything, literally EVERYTHING I ordered was a treat for my taste buds.   We ordered: - Scallops: Really good and flavorful sauce. It was grilled so had a nice little crisp.   - Chicken chennai: 2nd favorite! It was spicy and tender and the sauce they had to accompany it soothed the heat. Even after eating a lot of pieces I never tired of the flavors.  - masala dosa: This thing is huge! At first I was skeptical about how it would taste, but it was really crunchy and tasty.   - Lamb: #1 favorite! So tender and tasty! I brought it home and ate it for lunch the next day, STILL DELICIOUS. Highly recommend!

_y9fFH7-7s7phjlol0Y9yQ.review_text: Dosa gets 5 stars from me because I think this is as good as it gets. The interior is both classy and comfortable; it successfully merges contemporary interior design with Indian-inspired aesthetics. There's plenty of tables for intimate and casual dining.  The bar was pretty packed for a Tuesday evening. Looks like people were enjoying an array of cool libations.  Now on to the food... Lotus Stem Day Boat Scallops were flavorful but once you mixed in either two sauces, it was over the top delicious. This was my first dish of the night and it really did set the tone for what was to come. Exciting indeed!  I could snack on the Green Mango & Paneer Dosa for days :P The paneer dosa was soft and gooey yet perfectly toasty..does this even make sense? You just have to try it.   The Prawn Masala w/ coconut rice exceeded my expectations. I didn't know a masala could taste that good! I especially loved the chunky texture because you could actually see the ingredients :) Also, there was just enough heat to tingle my taste buds. Don't worry people, it's not too spicy.  It's just right.   I wrapped up my meal with the Pistachio Dacquoise w/ Chocolate Chile Mousse which was exactly what I needed. There's a beautiful play on textures with all the layered ingredients. The level of sweetness was just enough to satisfy my sweet tooth without making me feel gluttonous [like other desserts can do].  I would highly recommend this restaurant because of its superb food, welcoming service, and cozy ambiance. Dosa sets the bar high and I may have ruined my chances of enjoying Indian food elsewhere :P  What can you do? I'm convinced Dosa does it best & I will definitely be back for more.

rrdBtp6OP0HLs-BQc-qmsQ.review_text: The night after eating here, I had a dream about eating here.   The fact that this incredible restaurant is on the other side of North American is soul-crushingly sad. I honestly am a little choked up thinking about it right now.  Picture an envelope of thin wrap-style bread, hiding away an inner core of potato, spices, and veggies. You tear the wrapper off and use it to scoop up some of the steaming middle mash. Then you fold it up, and dip it into a spicy broth, trying hard not to drip as you lift it to your mouth and chew.  It's heaven. It's sexy, sexy food. There's something about the handling of the food, the way you create your own perfect bite every time, that just satisfies me so much. I know I won't be back in San Fran for quite a while, but as soon as I return, I'm going back!

1W86dgJ8g-CS1j9wMQ66HQ.review_text: Fabulous ambience-check Great service-check Novel dishes aka spicy basil dosa-check Ridonkulously tasty food-check Yummy cocktails-check Natasha+All of the above= Blissful camper

Yn28vLtAgMeQWHWwKFowVg.review_text: Wife and I decided to hold our Indian family baby shower here this past weekend and we had the most wonderful experience. Dan Dowdell was our point-man and he did an incredible job. Our group was about 50 people (including a couple of kids) and Dan helped us create an incredible brunch menu of apps and dosas. On the big day, Dan and the entire staff provided simply incredible and attentive service. Everything was delicious and the food was served perfectly warmed and seasoned. Dan kept a watchful eye on the crowd and ensured that no one (including the kids) were without food or drink. We had reserved the private room upstairs and it was the perfect mix of intimate and yet roomy with tall windows overlooking the gorgeous restaurant and Post St.  We couldn't have wished for a better experience. Thanks so much Dan and the entire crew at Dosa. We'll definitely be back for moer.

z6tUtUBUYsnfbiVfcWq2bw.review_text: Awesome place. Love it!!!!!! Highly Recommended.   I grew up in chennai, i am really picky about my south Indian food. I really loved it, will go again soon.   Here is what we got: * Vada Pav - 5 star * Watermelon, Panner, Moong, Salad - 5 stars * Dahi Vada - 4 Starts * South Indian Moon - 5 Stars * Sambar - 5 Stars * Ginger Ante (Drinks) - 5 Stars * Pistachio Dacquoise (Dessert) - 5 Stars

Rkhm3bht88rhk5pR3kF3FA.review_text: Pros: Fantastic south indian food, and great ambiance.  This place just has some sort of positive magic in it that keeps me coming back.  Suggested orders: South Indian Bhel Puri Poori Rasam Fire Broth  Cons: If you order rotee, which they have a lot of, it's mainly just a whole lot of bread (and in my opinion not too flavorful--only the sauces are), so if you are going for low carb that's not a great option.  I would recommend just ignoring the rotee section of the menu and focusing on the much more flavorful and diverse items like the ones I suggested.  Fun: At one point we had 12 unique types of sauce on our table.  I took a photo and uploaded it to yelp.  Amazing.

7nqRBP4g-MLMX1rQpBLRYg.review_text: Truly a top-notch, eclectic fusion experience. Regardless of whether you are an anti-Chicken Tikka Masala kid who grew up on authentic Indian food, like me, or a complete stranger to the world of Indian masalas and "bad with spicy food" (some of the friends I came with), I would highly recommend this restaurant.   Started off the night with the adorably-named 'Mango is the New Black' drink. The combination of dry whiskey, spicy mango nectar, and spicy agave left a really burn sensation but was also the perfect amount of sweet. I would like to come back and try other drinks here for sure.   For the main course, we ordered the South Indian Moons (combo uttapam plate), Spicy Basil Dosa, Goan Shrimp Curry, and Chicken Korma. The uttapams very small and cute, but there were about 9-10 pieces (great plate to share with people). The plate had a white truffle and mushroom uttapam -- didn't know this could be a thing!! The Spicy Basil Dosa was also SO delicious. The sauce was basically a traditional mint and cilantro chutney with an Italian pesto spin. It was spread all over the Dosa, not served on the side.    The shrimp and chicken items were tasty but next time I will veer away from these traditional curries and try more of their fusion items - Chennai Chicken, Shredded Duck, etc.  Come here with an open mind and empty stomach...and make it a mission to try as much as you can. I'm sure you will leave feeling absolutely delighted (although your pocket will feel a little lighter... it is totally worth it!).

r6YZkCa2cksxHghIBsiW_g.review_text: Lost it's touch a bit. Not with the food, the food is amazing, but with the service. Felt under appreciated. Not enough hosts, had to wait for a table in a nearly empty restaurant. Then was sat next to waiter station and felt like I was having dinner with the wait staff's butts all night and was not clear person who exactly was our waiter. The women's bathroom even at 6:00pm was running out of toilet paper and was quite messy. I love this place, love the food, just for this one night it was a bad vibe to spend 100's of dollars. Advice, consider sliding that table away from that station. I would have said all this to the waiter at the end of the night rather than writing this review but no one asked us how was everything, or how was the food.

VYsCv5goBR9VCk9C7dqX4w.review_text: I went to Dosa to celebrate my 30th birthday and had a party of 16. The customer service was excellent. They helped me customize a menu to meet the needs of all my guests and even brought us menu's with my name on them. I called several popular restaurants in SF before choosing Dosa based on the service they provided.  I've eaten here several times before and have found everything that I order to be delicious.

D5gZY2z1sKp4raeq2eFLUg.review_text: I can definitely say that I have a new favorite restaurant in San Francisco. This is a "foodie" town, and the bar is set super high, but I feel that the meal I had last night at  Dosa surpassed any meal that I have had in the Bay Area, in the last year.   I loved everything that we got-- my only suggestion, if I had to pick something, would be that the filling in the Dosa is only in the center and it makes it a little hard for everyone to get some of the filling, when sharing.  The flavors were rich without being overpowering and the portions were perfect. I can't wait to go back.

KW-X4cQ2yBZYVUjFaAY04A.review_text: PROS: Delicious chutneys & desserts, nice ambiance CONS: A bit pricy  Wow! These are the best chutneys I've ever had! The green mango paneer dosa was really good too! Don't forget to order a dessert --- the coconut pudding and saffron cheesecake were out of this world! Double thumbs up! :)

z1x4SS66Un2QY4ZXyyUpVA.review_text: THIS PLACE WAS AMAZING.   I went with my friend and her parents who were visiting, and we got to try a lot of items on the menu. The design and layout of the restaurant is very chic and classy. The server was really kind and helpful. She explained to us in fine detail what each dish we asked about was.   We had so many appetizers, they're chutney variety in the sampler was amazing, and you get the pappadum on on the side. We also tried the samosas which were fried to a perfect crisp with flavor that popped, and the chennai chicken which had the perfect amount of spice and came with a delightful yogurt dip. We tried one of the dosas, but unfortunately I have no clue which one it was. Ours had potatoes and some great spices in it, which yummy sauces and lentil soup to eat it with. For the main course, my friend and I split the prawn masala with the coconut rice. The portion was perfect to be split with two. I've only had chicken tikka masala before, but it tasted amazing with the prawns. The sauce was perfectly rich and creamy, with a mind-blowing bold flavor. I would recommend this dish 1000000 times. I also suggest that everyone keep all their sauces, because each dish comes with a unique dip, sauce, chutney that is amazing in its own way.

S5dV0F50kQLghfc7mSxBwQ.review_text: Dosa was the best meal i've had in quite some time. If you want full-bodied food with flavor and spice, this is your place.  First of all that pappadam bread they serve you with dipping sauces is simply out of this world. And they kept bringing it! Seriously, it was so simple but amazing. Flavor, texture, man. So SO good. We also ordered this yogurt sauce to dip it into. Also incredible. I went for the dosa option with sweet peppers and chard. I asked for hot - burn your mouth off hot. Usually at curry restaurants I still need to put hot sauce on supposedly "burn your mouth off" heat levels, but dosa brought it. My mouth was on fire and it was so so good. The mango lassi by my side really kept in handy while bringing the heat down a bit. Not to mention it was delicious. And the flavor, man. So incredible. It was my first time ever experiencing a dosa and my mind was blown.  We did have to wait FOREVER with a reservation for our party of three, but man was it worth it. Looking forward to returning without a doubt.

sEyHTyMF3nQ0kMjAEZx6Tg.review_text: Love this place- great decor, service and parking!  Samosas are wonderful, with veggies/spinach and an array of sauces. Dosa rocks, plenty of vegetarian options such as veggie curry, lentils, potato curry dishes.  Friends had the lamb curry, they said was delish!  Fresh ingredients, blend of spices are wonderful...curry is awesome, hot and sweaty, but awesome.  Very unique and tasty cocktails too!

a2sK9zyR5GfK0-4t1Fc1fQ.review_text: I wouldn't even care to come here if it wasn't for Adrian McCaffrey and Juan santamaria.  This place has some very, very amazing food which obviously comes with a high price but, Juan is simply the star, and I think that if the house only knew, they would have lines waiting out front. This man has not only good morals but also values his customers as if they were his.   Owners, give this man a raise or promote him if you want your business to blossom. Not only that he is loyal, he is also very-very hard working and always smiles and says please and thank you. To another successful business owner, it means a lot.  Thank you for reading,  Gary Kassimov - President Gary's Guaranteed Rooter, Inc.

7ESNUP6lOTrqfVEI7Bbt8g.review_text: Love this restaurant! It has lovely decor, always crowded and the desserts are really good.  I usually come here when I need my chai and rasmalai fix!

BfwkErYYxxI0WM2ZISl_Qg.review_text: I may be biased as I'm just not a fan of Indian food (although this is Indian food with a fusion twist or something and it is higher quality than what I normally experience). Good spice levels which I enjoyed, although some on my party who can't handle the spice struggled. But like most of my Indian food experiences, my stomach was not quite right the next day, if you catch my drift

5VVW-QKEfb5swQuTPLQBFA.review_text: Great indian/fusion food. Great taste, good ambiance.

UYlK3Ck2WOmDCmqC3h_G-Q.review_text: This place was phenomenal. Perfectly crafted cocktails and some unique but authentic dishes. I really enjoyed the Mung bean salad with pomegranate and persimmon. It was my favorite dish by far and I look forward to trying to recreate it! The cauliflower and kohlrabe soup was also spiced but not over spiced and the flavors all came together really well.   Definitely get the mango is the new black cocktail. Coming at a close second is the F1 sidecar.   My friend raved about the woda sambar. It had fresh drumsticks (vegetable) in it which is pretty rare. I also ordered the lamb vindaloo with coconut rice. The coconut rice was good. Although I like Thai coconut rice more,  my friend who grew up on Indian good said that it was amazing.   All in all a great experience. I will definitely return on my next trip to San Francisco.   Note: this place is popular. Show up early and expect an hour wait around 630 on a weekend or around the holidays (I'm guessing). But you can also get a seat  at   the bar pretty easily before 630.

ozlVgzC2Ty7ypyKhr_VKRQ.review_text: I have enjoyed many Northern Indian dishes and have thought that Indian food is certainly one of my great favorites that I constantly seek out wherever I travel. Until I found Dosa I thought I had experienced Indian food. I had only experienced half of what the sub continent has to offer.  Dosa is Southern Indian and although some of the spices are very similar to Northern Indian cuisine, the whole experience is quite different and, I have to say, refreshingly so.  Everything we had was awesome, so much so that we both overindulged.   Starting with their papadum and chutney sampler, we knew we were in for a treat. We actually accepted the very kind offer for more papadums just to keep sampling the chutneys and when the waiter wanted to clear them away we asked for them to stay throughout the meal.  The actual dosas are so enormous that we opted for 2 of their smaller sibling called poori not wanting to fill up on bread. Next time we will get a dosa but hopefully we will have others to share it with. They really are enormous.  We had prawn masala, Tamil lamb, and lamb chops because we couldn't get enough of the lamb which was really tender and juicy with incredible spices. Another interesting dish was the dahi rice which is more the equivalent of raita in the north and not really a rice dish per se. Necessary though as a cooling dish to compliment the spices. Without a dosa one really needs a rice dish so we opted for basmati just because all the dishes had so much really tasty sauce which we could not send back.  The drink menu eat Dosa is extensive and I was very happy to find a selection of wines that compliment the food really well. A bottle of Saarstein Riesling did not disappoint. Initially I thought that it may be too sweet, although advertised as off dry, but as the dinner progressed and the spices built, it turned out to be another perfect cooling element.  Our server, Mike, was excellent and thoroughly understood our tastes. He suggested the lamb chops when we ordered an extra dish late in the dinner, and it was a perfect addition.   Looking forward to our next visit to Dosa when we will definitely get one even if it requires a doggie bag!

PeUNSkq5J7cTNykmyTmTqQ.review_text: How in the world do these lamb chops taste so yummy? Wish I had one of these in LA.

Clqm0J7MEiJWavL_IgXFXw.review_text: I came over to this place for the first time and man the food is damn good. I think when ever i m coming to sf i m gonna come to this place.  Highly recommend it to all yelp readers.

h8cpd5TRh5RUd-7etwQdrA.review_text: Dosa with a difference. Ambience and service are excellent.

NKKW2bUyFUGy15-Fvc0KJw.review_text: I loved this place! I thought it would be a very casual location. I was very surprised with the decor, the setting, the ambiance. It was wonderful. The service, quality and the food was excellent!  Multiple choices, the portions were large for me, but I shared which was nice. Mango lassi was very tasty.

LW04xVASLI39mKbEmXOi8Q.review_text: GREAT food!  I ordered Vada Pav for an appetizer, which is a MUST !  Then I ordered the White Truffle Masala which was really good! I am a mushroom lover, and the hint of truffle oil on the dosa tasted so good with the masala!   The South Indian Monsoon drink was very light and refreshing!  I can't wait to go back again!!

N_5eitlIGDavnjUuxQVRzA.review_text: Venue: Came here on a Wednesday night and was immediately impressed with the decor. This was an upscale Indian restaurant and it sort of surprised me since I didn't know what to expect coming in - gf made the reservation.   Food: Decent. We started with the Chennai chicken and Paper Dosa which were both quite tasty. I've never had Dosa before so it was very interesting and i walked away a fan. The 3 dipping sauces were unique and I would recommend trying all three together.  My one complaint was that our entree (lamb curry with lemon rice) took way too long to come out and wasn't very good at all.  Overall it is a nice date spot and I'd come back again to try other dishes but for Indian food I prefer to go to a hole in the wall like Pakwan.

dC5kYsLGGoLLVlMjeMqfLw.review_text: I can't say how much I love Dosa. Every time I go back...I fall in love just a little bit more.   Let's start with how beautiful the restaurant is. Just stunning. Next...the bartenders and servers are awesome. The hosts are always friendly. Again...can't say enough great things.   Menu highlights -  *chutney sampler appetizer - 3 chutneys (sweet onion, cranberry cilantro mint, and roasted chile garlic) - great with papadum *chennai chicken appetizer - boneless chicken marinated in yogurt with coriander and onion *Masala Dosa *Paneer and Peas Dosa *coconut rice (simple and delicious) *Peony cocktail - gin, hibiscus masala nectar, coconut milk, lime and chile - LOVE THIS!   Overall...I love, love, love Dosa and I know once you experience their goodness...you will too!

eCwPKNUy3mG3vELwB8peZg.review_text: My wife, and I had the opportunity to dine at DOSA on Fillmore during Dine about Town in January. DOSA on Fillmore is a vibrant and elegant place that has fantastic food to enjoy with friends and loved ones.   Food & Drinks: [$36.95/ea. Wine Pairing $22/ea.]   * First Course       * South Indian Bhel Puri - Puffed rice, green mango, beets, potatoes, tomatoes, onions & coriander, spicy & sweet chutneys       * Lotus Stem Day Boat Scallops - Cilantro, chiles, mustard, maple sauce, with fried lotus stems       * Wine: Sula Chenin Blanc * Second Course       * Green Mango & Paneer Dosa - Spicy, pickled mango relish, shredded farmer's cheese, cilantro       * Trumpet Mushrooms Uttapam - Light drizzle of truffle oil, cilantro & curry leaves, grilled pancake-style        * Wine: Kawarau Sauvignon Blanc * Third Course       * Chicken & Eggplant - Natural, boneless, "bharta"-style roasted and pureed eggplant & peas with lemon rice       * Tamil Lamb - Free-range & natural, fennel, tomatoes, poppy seeds, caramelized onions & spices with lemon rice       * Wine: Old York Malbec  Overall, each item we ordered was very delicious and had it's own unique taste and texture. For our first dish the Puri had a nice sweet crunchy texture that was spot on. The scallops were good, but didn't stand out compared to the second and third course. Now the DOSA's, that was just amazing! A warm gooey cheese inside cooked perfectly, and when you dip it into the sauces it just melts in your mouth. The Uttapam was like any other pancake-style item that taste good, but taste even better once you dip it into the sauces! Our third and final course made the dinner even more spectacular as the flavors just popped. The Tamil Lamb has a nice spicy kick to it (medium) that brings out the wonderful flavors, while the Chicken & Eggplant tasted great with the lemon rice. The wine's for each course complimented the dishes well.  As for the service, it was just mediocre. We had to wave our hands to get their attention as they just walked by us a few times without even looking or seeing how we're doing.  Last but not least, it's nice to know that "DOSA is committed to sustainable & healthy choices by using local & organic ingredients as much as possible, natural, free-range & grass-fed lamb, cage-free eggs, anti-biotic-free & hormone-free chicken, fresh & sustainably-caught fish and non-GMO oils."   Quick Tips:     * Make reservations!    * Get there at least 15 minutes early to find parking!    * Full menu is online.  The Good: Fantastic Flavorful Foods | Vibrant Atmosphere | Elegant Decor  The Bad: Service | Parking

LMoK9BUP6Tgfc0AeDVbZHQ.review_text: Why Dosa's IS a 5-star place:  When you are emotionally overcome with deep sadness upon taking the last bite of your meal... you know you've eaten something special. I ordered the paneer and peas dosa. And it was gastronomical art. Accompanied with sambar and both a tomato and coconut chutney (I believe the coconut had cilantro in it - and I'm one of those people who LOATHE cilantro, but in this? It was totally acceptable!), my heart physically ached upon taking that final bite. Goodbye, beautiful meal, thank you for existing!  And yes, as the menu suggested, I totally used my fingers to eat... and classy restaurants that let me play with my food? INSTA-FIVE STAR.  The servers were incredibly informed about the components of each dish. I appreciated how, in a totally non-pretentious way, that explained their concept, what went best with what, why things were made a certain way, etc. And, I was a little seduced by the atmosphere in general - the decor was uber tasteful and classy, the lighting was romantically low, the background music was house/techno, and the clientele was all over the map. I'm one of those people who appreciate when four things that don't necessarily organically go together (fancyschmancy interior design, sexy time lighting, music that I want to rave to, and people I could either be having a business meeting or a bachelorette party with) do. Because in this instance, it totally works!  However, there are two reasons why Dosa's ISN'T getting 5-stars from me (feel free to stop reading here if you want, because they really are "As good as it gets!", except for...)  Reason #1, "Space Invaders Are No Bueno With Me" - Maybe it's because physically I'm a tiny chick, but people often associate my stature with age. Being little =/= being young. And when you're "young" it's okay to have your personal space invaded (or so is the mindset of many adults). That being said, the waitstaff at Dosa's definitely invaded my personal space every go-around with the plates (something I didn't notice them doing with other people). They would stand in back of me, reach around my torso/face with two arms to lift or place plates over my head. Again, something that probably wouldn't even register on other folk's radars, but it did on mine. And...  Reason #2, "Petty, Petty Pie Princess" - When I found out we were going to Dosa's, I did what any sane yelper does - I looked up their menu. The very first thing that caught my eye was some banana goat cheese pie thing. SOLD. That was the single thing I look forward to eating. When it came time for dessert, though, guess what wasn't on the menu? Mhmm, the banana goat cheese pie. We asked the server if they still carried it. "I'm sorry, we don't. But it was SOOOOOOO good. Like... seriously, so, so, so good. It's really too bad we don't carry it anymore," was her response. I don't want to hear how delicious something I can't have is, so the appropriate response - in my obviously humble opinion - would have been: a) "I'm sorry, we don't," (which is to the point without telling me whether it was good or not leaving me opinion-less and not dessert h'angry) or, b) "Not anymore. It wasn't that good anyway," with a wink and a playful smile (which is more fun and less braggy).  In the end... my advice? Go to Dosa's. Eat then weep at how gorgeous your meal was.  (Then weep some more because of a dessert you can't have.)

HAkqx1swwy6hyWTtLI3byg.review_text: If I could give this place zero stars, I would. I was visiting San Fran, and was having a special day out with my aunt and her partner. I felt like the server was intentionally trying to piss us off. When we went in, the server took forever to take our orders even though the restaurant was empty save a couple in the corner and one other small family. She was chatting with the small family forever. Then when she took our drink orders, we all ordered chai tea. When my aunt got it, she didn't realize it was milk based and asked the server for another drink since she's lactose intolerant. That also took forever because our server said she kept forgetting... When we finally got our food, no one explained what the sauces were to us. This wouldn't have been a problem if I didn't hear the server explain everything in detail to the couple sitting in the corner. After, my aunt ordered another drink which she just never got.  Perhaps it was a race thing since we were the only people of color in the restaurant, or maybe our server just had some unknown, personal vendetta against us. Either way, I'm never going back there. San Francisco has way too many nice places to give Dosa a second chance.

sIxpuER7S9Lzn45hVocJnw.review_text: Best Savory Crepe I've ever had. The Veggie Thali is definitely worth trying!

xpGT-LaDdd5SaHA6kP2MQg.review_text: I don't think I have ever seen a more extravagant Indian restaurant. Decorations-wise, this place was absolutely beautiful. I was more interested in looking around at the intricate lamps and the paintings and the than I was in actually eating my food.   I came here for a casual dinner, so I ended up spending much more than I had planned. We ordered a bunch of plates for sharing amongst the group, as well as individual meals. I ordered the masala dosa where the dosa was made out of wheat, and was greatly displeased. It was pretty much impossible to eat because it was crunchy rather than your typical dosa which is foldable. How am I supposed to eat the masala?!?!! I struggled and struggled with my dosa until I finally just left it up for grabs for everyone else while I worked on the other dishes.   The watermelon, sprouts, and paneer salad was probably among the most innovative dishes I've ever seen. Seemed to me like an spinoff of what everyone is raving about these days - the watermelon-feta salad, and they did an amazing job of recreating an Indian version of it. I had seconds and thirds (and maybe fourths but don't tell anyone) of it and I didn't even feel guilty because....it's watermelon! And sprouts! Guilt-free!!!! The chennai chicken is to die for but I felt bad after eating maybe 2 pieces because that stuff looked deep-fried and then fried once more and then deep-fried again. Terribly oily and crispy, but it definitely should be tried on a cheat day. There was one more dish I particularly liked, and it had shrimp in it and was some kind of curry. Forgot the exact name though, but I think it's one of the only dishes with shrimp on the menu. The main courses themselves (as for me, I only had the unmanageable dosa) were nothing to rave about, in my honest opinion.  Overall, love the ambience. Food was good, but not THAT great especially for what I paid. 4 stars felt a little too generous, but don't let that stray you away! If you're feeling rich one night and feel like getting some Indian, definitely try out this place. If you are ballin on a budget, stay away. You can get cheap but good Indian food on literally any corner up in San Francisco.

ermgOO9meehk-dfG0Fsfhw.review_text: Fancy Indian food.  It was good but do I really want fancy Indian food? Is it better? It feels smoother, cleaner and more sophisticated. It was great food, but not sure of price point.

ZAMwPHsVoltNefhkINWmow.review_text: Went here for our anniversary dinner last week, for the first time. Overall, we enjoyed it, and I would probably go back, but with a couple of caveats.  The Good: The happy hour appetizers we tried (the kale pakora and vegetarian sliders) were really, really good. And at the $6 happy hour price, no regrets. I enjoyed the sweet potato dosa we got, though my husband was a bit less enthusiastic. The cocktail menu is fascinating. Only tried one--the peony--but it was absolutely delicious--tasted like melted sorbet or something. I usually can't drink gin anymore, but it didn't even taste like gin. Dangerous! I'd love to try some of the other special cocktails, but at $12 a pop, you really do have to limit yourself. The restaurant itself is beautiful and spacious. Everything we tried was tasty, though the prices are too high. Our waiter was nice, helpful, attentive. There is a parking garage right next door, and since it's run by the city, it's only $1/hour--a good find in the City of No Parking.  The Bad: Overpriced. The lamb tamil tasted good, but it was a tiny serving for $26, plus you have to order rice or dosa with it as a side (they don't really give you the option not to) and that adds an extra $3-5 to that $26 plate. It definitely wasn't good enough (or substantial enough) to be worth $30. (We get one at a hole-in-the-wall down the street that's just as good or better for $8.) In fact, everything on the menu is pretty much a la carte and too expensive (besides the happy hour appetizers!). The bartender was really rude. I didn't feel like he was overly rude to us (though my husband did--I guess he's more sensitive), just not overly nice either, but he was definitely rude to someone who came and sat down on the other side of us. This person was trying to order something from him as he was making some drinks, and instead of politely telling him something like, "I'll be right with you," he snapped, "I'm not ready for that." With attitude. Even though he didn't do anything like that to us, the attitude was definitely, "I'm doing you a favor by answering your question or taking your order." I can do without the attitude. I have been a server/bartender and I know when you're busy it can be tempting to be short with customers, but it's unacceptable. I never did it and I don't expect my servers/bartenders to do it to me. But, like I said, our waiter at our table was great, and the hostesses were fine as well. The happy hour drink menu is only for one beer, two wines and a margarita, all $6 except the beer (which is $4). That is a decent (but not amazing) price for those drinks, but it was disappointing that there wasn't some kind of discount on their awesome cocktails during happy hour...but fine, whatever. The happy hour food menu sort of makes up for that, I guess.   I guess you are paying for the experience as much as the food itself, and we did have a nice evening, but I don't see it becoming a regular spot for us.

bWnk2fbDyJk36liaJXidQg.review_text: Staying in Japantown for the weekend, looking for something tasty -- score!   The place was nearly full, and we had no reservations, but we lucked out.  (Many thanks to the hostess!)   There were three of us, so we decided to splurge and order a bunch of things to share -- good decision.  Started with the chutney sampler -- everyone found a new favorite.    North and South samosas -- North were some of the best potato samosas I've had, but the South was delightfully sweet and savory.  Warning -- that innocent little side salad has something quite spicy in/on it.  The tamarind chutney had been in the sampler, but cilantro chutney was different, and not scary spicy.  Bhatura - big, poofy, and delicious -- with or without any of the many chutneys available on the table by the time we were done.  (It lasted pretty much the whole meal.)  Lamb boti kebab -- yummy, but if we weren't splurging, it wouldn't make the cut.  Chennai chicken was delightful with and without the yogurt dip on the side.  Lots of finger-size pieces, perfect for sharing.  The lamb dosa had the lamb on the side, along with two more chutneys, different from the others, and the sambar soup.  Definitely will get that again.  So flavorful.  The potato dosa was good too, but again, if we weren't splurging, it wouldn't make the cut.  Same sambar and chutneys as the lamb dosa.  So much food, but we figured it wouldn't hurt to look at the dessert menu.  Glad we did.  White chocolate pot creme -- next time, we'll get two.  The perfect contrast to all the spicy foods that preceded it.  Coconut custard cake -- not sure why this is called cake.  Tasty, but the pot creme dessert took the blue ribbon.  We don't get to the City often, but this will be on our list for a return trip -- with reservations next time.  And definitely when we have vegetarian friends along.

zi2q1HxObUyaXOiLf86yNg.review_text: Upscale Indian restaurant. Went on Saturday morning for lunch. Loved the ambience and the food.  Service was bit of miss - they goofed up on order and billing but made up with complementary desserts.  Hence not taking off a star.   We ordered a bunch of dishes from the ever popular Chennai Chicken, to Vada Pav, Puri's ( for my 3 year old), Frankie ( ordered Shrimp but got lamb instead as they mixed up our order), Medu Vada and 2 mini dosa's ( Which come with a side of salad).  The salad was huge and filling. The dosa's were tasty ( masala dosa and a uttapam) and crisp.   The desserts ( rasmalai, tea flavored mousse and beetroot cake) were all stellar.   Would go back in a heartbeat. Hopefully service will be better this time!

n5Ipptv27ew3lW1k0ukuIQ.review_text: Love this place... Great dishes and nice spicy drinks

KqIhoFVQJpGAGcd21AD3EQ.review_text: They promote themselves as South Indian food restaurant but there is nothing authentic about their food, neither their Dosas nor their Uttapams or their entrees. Dosa is basically street food in India that you get for very cheap; charging for the decor I suppose because the food is nowhere tasty unless people don't know what authentic South Indian food is like and love this place. We would still frequent this place very often due to the proximity of this location to where we live as we needed our dose of Indian food kick!  A major drawback of eating at this place is the service. Every time me and family visit, the waiters do not let us order what we want and instead keep telling us "You are ordering too much! You don't need to order this and that and blah blah...." I mean, what's up with that??? Why can't we order what we want? Is ordering 2 appetizers and 2 entrees for 2 people too much? It seems for their staff it is (We are not a family of obese people mind you, if you think all we do is eat). They just wouldn't let us order appetizers telling us "The entrees would be enough. Don't order appetizers it will be too much!" We could box up the leftovers if its too much. We have never had a restaurant staff forcing us to not order what we want! And every time we ordered something else someone new would arrive to take the order. They keep switching the waiters.  Low on kitchen staff? Then hire more people! Don't tell customers to order less. If this had happened once or twice I won't even mention it. We have frequented this place more than 15 times now and every time it has been the same - aggressive pushy attitude when it comes to ordering food. We know what we want and how much we want, we don't want the restaurant staff telling us not to order this or that. We have stopped eating here due to this and have no intention to go back! There are better South Indian restaurants in the city anyways so might as well drive farther away from home than put up with pushy service.

L3GWuD2vJbsMGlzrtZtDJw.review_text: Dosa! I love you!  Chris our server tonight was amazing. My dining experience tonight was great: right from checking in to paying the bill and heading out. Tonight I ordered: 1. Vada pav (Indian sliders) *beware it can be very hot (spicy) so if you can't handle hot food, let your server know. A must try!!  2. Rava dosa (semolina crepe): loved it. Crispy enough to my liking! So yummy with the sambhar and chutneys...highly recommend trying this as a change to the regular dosa  3. Payasam dessert was delicious with just right amount of sweetness. The quantity is good for sharing between two to three people, so keep that in mind when ordering.  4. BEST for the last: masala chai. So so so good!! Oh! If it hasn't been 8:00pm, I would have ordered another cup... Don't wanna stay up and hoot like an owl ;)  I think Yelp has just outdone itself by adding this kickass feature to the Yelp app - composing, editing and posting reviews via the app!! Go Yelp!

J4n2SCZnuupzQIjUh_yN2A.review_text: Very nice dosa's and sambar. Little pricey, parking is a hassle.

qUmdLKwfxd7-Ph_hbMdMUg.review_text: We decided to check this place out on a Saturday night. It was jam packed. The decor of the restaurant  is gorgeous. It looks like one of those swanky restaurants on Sex and the City.We were told without a reservation we would have to wait an hour for a table. However, the host was able to seat us in about 30 in the bar area. The food was awesome. We went with some recommendations from our waiter. It's a must if you're in the city.

BdRMVROS1MXOHxr-bdZv0g.review_text: Great date spot. The indian food is definitely made for a western palate but it's executed well and the ambiance can't be beat.  High ceilings with a swanky bar area. The food here is substantial to say the least. Definitely share. and definitely get a Dosa (they're like giant samosas without the fried skin).  Unique cocktail list "made for spicy food".   Don't come here expecting an authentic indian experience. but DO come here to hang with friends or on a date because it won't be a controversial choice.

8y4gLTcOpYZSx5v352AsWg.review_text: Been to both the locations a countless times (Dosa @ Fillmore & Valencia) but this one hands down is my favorite..  What we usually order: -Tamil Lamb with Malaysian Paranthas: Spicy & YUM (Lately for some reason, they are mostly out of their malaysian paranthas) -Dahi Rice: It used to be really good but taste has gone down a bit the past two times I have ordered it. It always needs some seasoning! -Paneer & Peas Dosa: My Husband's all time favorite!! Their Paper Masala Dosa and Chile Utthapam is pretty decent as well -Idli Sambhar: Super  -Chennai Chicken: Another yummer -Lamb Chops: Little sweet for my indian taste buds -Vada Pav: Mini sliders..Perfect and so tasty!  This was definitely a 5 starred restaurant for us, but in my last two visits to Dosa, I was a little unhappy with my Dahi rice and Sambhar, and hence the 4 stars. Another thing that I usually get very annoyed with is their constant menu changes, another downer for me.   Not a big fan of their desserts except one, so if you love mangoes, make sure you leave some room for their mango pudding, tried & tested many times!! :)  Tip: Weekdays or Weekends, the place is always crowded, so always best to make reservations.

Lflz5NW_Sj0h3rSUYiBd8A.review_text: I love this place! It's got a lovely, trendy ambiance and some killer cocktails. The food is so good (& spicy!). I love spicy food  so the Chennai Chicken is a must. As are the samosas and the Lamb Keema Dosa. Honestly, portions are huge so family style is best. As for drinks, I liked the Mango is the New Black, and the Peony.   It is on the pricier side, so definitely a place to enjoy on special occasions.

kroQYWSj-BhIEXT4VwLRHA.review_text: Not that anymore yelp reviews will add to what has been said about Dosa on Fillmore (geez some 800-900 wow). Here is my 2 cents.  I made reservations through the yelp site...really easy and dosa got the reservation and we were seated right away. We asked to be seated upstairs on a rainy night and it was just wonderful upstairs. The service for us was stellar: prompt, not overbearing, very helpful and just really nice people. I am talking from the waiter, to the bus boy, the drink waiter they were all just great.  I love Indian food as I have spent many a night down on 6th street in new york...Mitali etc ( the hotter the better...bring on the lamb vindaloo).  Dosa has wonderful Indian food it varies from what I am used to (as there are so many different regions...India is a big friggin place) but they execute really well and the flavors and textures and the presentation are very nice. Prices are not cheap...but than you are dinning in a very nice place with very nice food and very nice service. This aint no pakistani naan and curry y'all.   In essence I would come back in a heart beat. It was really really good!!

4GBpeWvfm3KRbywjhbQ33g.review_text: I really enjoyed the Masala Dosa.  very similar to one I recently ate in India.

ddwzM5V8o2-GzGGZLCXyYw.review_text: Great husband and I dropped in spontaneously in this large corner restaurant in the Fillmore (used to be the Goodwill Store--now across the street) having walked by it for several years and just going in for drinks from time to time.  What we have been missing!  Our server, Stephen, should win an award for patience and grace and knowledge.  He described the menu offerings clearly and suggested good combinations.  He certainly was spot-on and a terrific guide.  Little puffed delights appeared with a green sauce and another unusual sauce with saucers of mung beans, garbanzo beans and potatoes all spiced to perfection which one can arrange inside the little puffs.  Then arrived the famous Dosa--mine filled with spicy basil potatoes--and the chutneys and dips to accent the large, light , crisp crepe-like triangle miracle that appeared before me.  Husband ordered the delicately rolled lamb-filled roti with vegetables and it was stunning in the depths of flavor.  Our meal did not make us feel stuffed--but we were satisfied that we had had a perfect meal that hit "all the notes."  This restaurant was everything we wanted it to be.  We still wanted something unusual after the terrific main courses! What made us faint was the chocolate/chili hazelnut-caramel dessert. Anchored with a pistachio rectangle of cake perfection and then topped with chocolate and a crisp plank of nuts and chili, this dessert simply is without equal.   This dessert made the meal perfect.  The tall ceilings and lovely decor and excellent service make the restaurant restful at lunch.  Dinner is different.  It is packed and hopping.  This place overflows at night around the bar and the busy, happy crowd varies in age--good sign.  If you have a sophisticated palate and like the adventure of identifying the great layers of spices and flavors, this is the place for you. Don't miss Stephen--the perfect host!!!
